heif.boxes

Class Box

  • java.lang.Object
    • heif.boxes.Box
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColourInformationBox, DataInformationBox, FileTypeBox, FullBox, ImageRotationBox, ItemDataBox, ItemPropertiesBox, ItemPropertiesBox.ItemPropertyContainerBox, ItemProtectionBox.ProtectionSchemeInfoBox, ItemProtectionBox.ProtectionSchemeInfoBox.OriginalFormatBox, ItemReferenceBox.SingleItemTypeReferenceBox

    public class Box
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic HEIF Box, according to ISO/IEC 14496-12:2015. Handles both standard boxes and uuid extended boxes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Box(Box box)
      A copy constructor to replicate field values one by one, useful for sub-classing, retaining the original field values.
      Box(SequentialByteReader reader)
      Constructs a Box by reading its header from the specified SequentialByteReader.

    • Method Detail

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Box parent)
        Sets the parent of this child box.
        Parameters:
        parent - the Box referencing to the parent box

      • getParent

        public Box getParent()
        Returns the parent box of this child box for referencing purposes
        Returns:
        the Box reference

      • getHierarchyDepth

        public int getHierarchyDepth()
        Returns the depth of this box within the box hierarchy. The root box has a depth of 0; each level below increases the depth by 1.
        Returns:
        the depth of this box in the hierarchy

      • getByteOrder

        public java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Returns the byte order, assuring the correct interpretation of data values. For HEIC files, the big-endian-ness is the standard configuration.
        Returns:
        either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

      • getTypeAsString

        public java.lang.String getTypeAsString()
        Returns the 4-character box type as a string.
        Returns:
        the box type in textual form

      • getBoxSize

        public long getBoxSize()
        Returns the total size of this box, or Long.MAX_VALUE if size is unknown.
        Returns:
        the box size

      • available

        public int available()
        Returns the number of remaining bytes in the box.
        Returns:
        remaining bytes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if malformed data is encountered. The box size is unknown (extends to EOF)

      • byteUsed

        public long byteUsed()
        Returns the number of bytes already read from this box.
        Returns:
        bytes read so far

      • getUserType

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getUserType()
        Returns the user type for a uuid box, or an empty Optional if not applicable.
        Returns:
        optional user type

      • getHeifType

        public HeifBoxType getHeifType()
        Returns the HeifBoxType of this box.
        Returns:
        the type

      • getBoxList

        public java.util.List<Box> getBoxList()
        Returns a list of child boxes, if applicable. Default is empty.
        Returns:
        list of contained boxes

      • logBoxInfo

        public void logBoxInfo()
        Logs a single diagnostic line for this box at the debug level.

        This is useful when traversing the box tree of a HEIF/ISO-BMFF structure for debugging or inspection purposes.

      • repeatPrint

        protected static java.lang.String repeatPrint(java.lang.String ch,
                                              int n)
        Generates a line of padded characters to n of times.
        Parameters:
        ch - string to be padded
        n - number of times to pad in integer form
        Returns:
        formatted string
